name: Dante Alighieri (1265-05-29 - 1321-09-14)
bio: Dante Alighieri was an Italian poet, writer, and philosopher. He is best known for his epic poem *The Divine Comedy*, considered one of the most important works of world literature and a cornerstone of Italian vernacular literature. His political beliefs led to his exile from Florence, during which he penned some of his most significant works.
